title: The shepheards delight To the tune of Frog Galiard.
author: W. T.
notes: Two ballads, one column each, printed on a halfsheet. The first, attributed by STC to Nicholas Breton; a corrupt version of a poem in STC 3633  Breton, Nicholas.  Brittons bowre of delights. The second, attributed by STC to Thomas Deloney, has title "A pleasant new ballad of Daphne. To a new tune".
Publisher's name and date of publication from STC.
Verse - "On yonder hill there springs a flower".
Reproduction of original in the British Library, London, England.
